alert.note: Alert for Gwinnett; Walton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 4:50AM EST until February 04 at 1:38PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Alcovy River near Lawrenceville affecting Gwinnett and Walton Counties. For the Alcovy River Basin...including Lawrenceville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Alcovy River near Lawrenceville. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins of the woodlands upstream and downstream from the river gauge at New Hope Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:31 AM EST Friday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 9.1 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this morning. - Flood stage is 9 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.1 feet on 05/04/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
